positive.review: im not saying that it's because of this game but the one friend i played overcooked 2 with stopped talking to me a few months later

Bruv, this is actually my favourite game on Steam. It's stupidly fun and the chaos is brilliant, but I'm not laughing at all - half the time I'm just losing my mind.
AND the internet...Nah mate, the connection is straight-up tragic. The lag has me moving like a donkey and makes me wanna shut my PC and rethink my life lol.
Fix the bloody net and it'd be a clean 10/10, no cap.

Overcooked 2 is great game to bring out your inner Gordan Ramsay and call your friends an idiot sandwich for pushing you off the map or constantly bumping into you. The DLCs were pretty fun additions to play, but is required to complete some of the Steam achievements. Good thing is that only the hosting player needs them for all other players to also be able to play those DLCs.

10/10. Would call my friends a donkey again.
It's Overcooked. It's 2. It's a rage game that teaches you how to play under pressure in a team with bad everything. It's responsible for many a scream, even in this short time.

A very fun co-op party game! Overcooked 2 is a wacky depiction of a restaurant's rush hour, where chefs have to run across to cook thousands of meals as quickly as possible. The game can be played singleplayer, but it is best enjoyed with friends, both locally as well as online. Levels feel unique and inspired, with absurd location and kitchen configurations that will make chefs lose their minds. Cooperation is crucial, even if it always a challenge to find a winning plan. Team 17 is known to publish couch games like these, and Overcooked 2 does not disappoint!
cute game, pretty fun lol and had me losing my mind in a good way lol.
A really great game to play with a partner or friends. My non-gamer significant other likes it a lot, and we spent hours playing this game.
Love this game! Super fun because I love fast paced things, and it gets me and my friends to work together and cooperate and we love the challenge to get all 3 stars on every level.
very fun especially with friends. I wish the scenery was more restaurant like tho

Best co-op game ever to test your communication and synergy skils with friends or spouses! If you get though this whole game with anyone, just know that your bond is stronger than most and will most likely last forever.

The game is really fun. Sometimes it gets a bit emotional when playing with friends, but that‚Äôs exactly what makes it exciting when you play together locally. I highly recommend playing it with colleagues or friends in local multiplayer. Playing online is great too, as long as you use voice chat to keep the fun going.

there are only 3 moods for this game.
1) Screaming at your friends about their incompetence.
2) Getting screamed at by your friends for your incompetence.
3) Going Grey with stress from playing the game solo.

Good fun all around.

As it turns out, your friends are always your worst enemies. Never playing with them again.

10/10

This game is really fun to play with a friend! it has easy and difficult challenges and will test if you and your friend can work together well. I've played this game fully twice now and i will definitely play it again one day! the characters are super adorable and i just love the visuals of this game too. the only issue i have with this game is that I NEED MORE LEVELS!! :D

[b] Amazing with friends (but not online), and unplayable alone [/b]

Overcooked is an incredibly fun and charming game, full of chaos, laughter, and great moments - as long as you‚Äôre not playing alone. The single-player mode is practically unusable. There‚Äôs no real adjustment for solo gameplay, no reduced star requirements, no alternative modes - nothing that makes it feel actually playable. 

Playing with friends is a completely different story - that‚Äôs when the real magic of Overcooked shines. But even here, there‚Äôs a huge issue that‚Äôs hard to ignore: it‚Äôs 2025, and cross-platform play is still labeled as a ‚Äúbeta feature.‚Äù And honestly, it feels like it.

Even if you ignore that part, online play is almost impossible. No matter how good your internet connection is, the non-host players will constantly experience heavy lag, making the game borderline unplayable. As many others already said, and I fully agree: only play this game if everyone is on the same device. Playing online will just ruin your nerves.

Overall, Overcooked! 2 is a fantastic game at its core, and I genuinely love it - which makes it even more disappointing that the developers never bothered to properly optimize online play or finish cross-platform functionality. The whole point of this game is to enjoy it with friends, and not all friends are always in the same room or even the same country.
good game to play with your girlfriend if u guys try to break up
Overcooked 2 is a super fun game to play with friends and even family. It is VERY chaotic but that makes all the more fun.

Incredible game but you after a point you need at least 3 people to get anything done. I imagine the player requirement gets even higher later on.
Highly recommend this game!! It's perfect to play with both family and friends.
i LOVE this game. like actually. it brings out the worst in me and i love it. would reccommend yelling at your friends over this game.
Simple but chaotically entertaining ! Even though the game was meant for playing in co-op, single player is a lot of fun as well ! Would absolutely recommend it if you can find it on sale
A great family, couples game if youre trying to learn to work together or if youre trying to start something
Fun and engaging game play encourages cooperation.  Great for children and parents.

Co op teamwork game.  Worse than the previous title, but is much the same.

I want the game to be larger in variety and content.  Letting the community make levels would be huge

If you cook professionally and try to play this game, especially online, you will oscillate between having fun and hating yourself for booting it up after a 14 hour service and prep shift. Hilarious that i can just put food on the ground with no penalty.
Pretty accurate kitchen simulator, there just needs to be even more yelling.
Amazing game.  Lots of fun as a party game. Give it a shot if you can!
I like the fast paced fun of the kitchen without the sweaty uncomfortable heat of an actual kitchen.

Had me stressing more than my actual relationship. It‚Äôs a great simulator if you want to experience high-stress environments while getting punished for doing a good job.
Exceptional party game.  It's hard to find better couch co-op out there.

negative.review: To much lagging when playing online. A fun game to play with others but will refund.

Fun in co-op, but fully finishing the game requires a mind-numbing amount of repeating the same levels over and over again doing the same three actions in circles. For example, there's an achievement that requires you to use ketchup or mustard 300 times on a hotdog, where you'll do this only 60-70 times naturally while playing the game and clearing all levels for all stars. Then there's 10 more like this. Burn this many wood, put coal this many times in the furnace. An order of magnitude more than you'll do naturally. Waste of time.

Doesn't support Playstation Controller icons - only Xbox (all it takes is an option in the settings to set the controller type if you're too lazy to put a simple piece of code to detect the controller type).
Buttons and activities aren't straight forward.

The save slots function is unreliable and poorly designed, you can easily lose your save with one wrong click on "new game" where you think it is "load game", and the game gives little warning about overwriting. Be careful with your saves, and I think the developers should remake their save system like other games that use world-based saves instead of slots - no one wants to go back to older saves, it is not Minecraft.
This is Hell in a video game. Doom Eternal on Ultra-Nightmare is easier that this fuck ass game.

it has huge bugs and has got different kind of issues when I tried to play the game recently. Such as I am unable to invite friends for no reasons, the invite button just doesnt work at all. It also does not support controller although it stated it could. Also, I am not able to go the right side at all when I start the game. The bugs remains after multiple times of restarting my PC. I can guarantee it is not my PC problem because it works fine before and I can play other games smoothly. This is super frustrating and wasting my time.
A little 2 Overcooked for me.

Massive input lag in multiplayer, makes this multiplayer game practically unplayable.
To much lagging when playing online. A fun game to play with others but will refund.

Buttons and activities aren't straight forward.

The save slots function is unreliable and poorly designed, you can easily lose your save with one wrong click on "new game" where you think it is "load game", and the game gives little warning about overwriting. Be careful with your saves, and I think the developers should remake their save system like other games that use world-based saves instead of slots - no one wants to go back to older saves, it is not Minecraft.

Hi. I don't ask for much in life. H*ell, sometimes I even forget to eat my veggies. But not today. Today, I completed two things I regret. This game looks pretty cool, but don't believe everything on the internet, as my great-granny once said. This game will make you want to sleep with your friends just to get away from the fact that you even tried to touch Kevin with your onion fingers. Recommend? I think not.
game constantly disconnects me and can not recognize a basic xbox controller
It's fun, but you definitely need friends to play. It's not my type of game.
This is Hell in a video game. Doom Eternal on Ultra-Nightmare is easier that this fuck ass game.
The perfect game for people who don't like video games. The best part was when I asked for my refund.
